column4: my Jetway PM800BMS motherboard computer doesn't detect my new SATA hard drive. do I need to detect/configure it in my BIOS?
I can't see any option to do that in the BIOS. just for "IDE" hard drives. I don't think SATA falls into that category
if you can plug a sata on your mobo it must be able to handle them ,  my sata is setup as a terciary master if that helps

by the way, my problem yesterday about my new SATA drive was a conflit between the speed of the drive and the one allowed by the motherboard. I needed to put a jumper on the hard drive to limit the speed to 1.5Gb
ahah , I knew it was a jumper thing

yes, following your advise I checked for jumpers on the motherboard, the site said it was a "jumperless" one, and that reminded me of a warning in the hard drive manual for rare cases where you needed a jumper...
no, not in the home partition, althought it gave an error in the root partition before
you should be warry of root partition error,  did you try rebooting ?
check the forum this has never happend to me, but I have a fair idea that you will need to reinstall
ok, thanks. I've tried reinstalling, yet same thing happens
that's what I think also, something wrong in the disk. thanks for your suggestion. I'll try it
